basics.name: Thomas Ringling
basics.label: Software Developer
summary: Living in Nærum with my wife Louise and my daughter Hannah.
I have 19 years of experience in software development within programming, architecture and leadership etc.
Thriving in environentments and cultures who value competences, innovation and creativity.

skills._description: Defines a skill. A Skill has a description and may be accompanied by sutiable documentation. Morever a Skill may be acquired during one or more experience periods, and be verified by one or more certificates

_description.name: RabbitMQ
_description.description: My goto message broker, be it via Docker, CloudAMQP or on-prem. Programmed in Erlang ;)

_description.name: ActiveMQ
_description.description: Used it in a PoC, a nice alternative to RabbitMQ

_description.name: DB2
_description.description: Only used it as a developer, never tried to set-up one

_description.name: Oracle
_description.description: Used it in school and on some of my jobs

_description.name: Mysql/MarieDB
_description.description: The first RDBMS I ever installed

_description.name: MSSQL
_description.description: The preferred RDBMS when in .NET-country.

_description.name: CouchDB
_description.description: I love the change feeds, db replication, stability and REST API of this NoSQL DB. Also programmed in Erlang ;)

_description.name: MongoDB
_description.description: Fast NoSQL

_description.name: Redis
_description.description: Key-value store, used as an alternative to Memcached

_description.name: Memcached
_description.description: Key-value store cache

_description.name: ElasticSearch
_description.description: NoSQL and Not_Only_A_Database - actually do not use it as a DB but as superfast search engine

_description.name: PostgreSQL
_description.description: My preferred open-source RDBMS database

_description.name: Ruby on Rails(RoR)
_description.description: My first meeting with Ruby and the power of metaprogramming

_description.name: Phoenix
_description.description: A functional web framework build on Elixir. Simplicity, stability, distribution, channels and performance baked in. Some things, just come with the language and platform(VM) itself

_description.name: Vue.js
_description.description: Adopted this framework very early, as it combines the simplicity of Ractive.js and a bunch of the good features from Angular, React and even Elm

_description.name: Elm
_description.description: After working with javascript for many years, I like the purity of a Haskell-like language and the 'no runtime errors' part

_description.name: Angular
_description.description: Been working with AngularJS and Angular(2.0)

_description.name: Ractive.js
_description.description: Lightweight javascript framework. Even though I primarily use Vue.js now, I like the simplicity of Ractive.js

_description.name: Ruby
_description.description: My goto scripting language. Also using Crystal(https://crystal-lang.org/) combining performance and Ruby expressiveness

_description.name: Elixir
_description.description: My goto dynamic, functional, distributed language. Together with Erlang, Elixir opened my eyes for the world of distributed systems

_description.name: C#
_description.description: 'Lingua franca' in the .NET world. But you should take a look at F# as well

_description.name: Java
_description.description: Learned it in school and have been using throughout my professional carrier

_description.name: Elm
_description.description: Fun Haskell-like, no-runtime errors, javascript alternative, like typescript, purescript or coffeescript - however in functional wrapping

_description.name: Javascript
_description.description: As I have been doing a lot of frontend development, there is no way to get around this one

_description.name: Typescript
_description.description: Java/C# in the frontend
